__e: When he moves it in the morning, we'll make our play.
All I've been up to now is a lousy bakery wagon.

But, as soon as you get to the first town, you can...
Now, if I had a horse, which I haven't, I'd go for it myself, which I won't, but I thought perhaps there might be somebody here with a horse and cart who'd like to go for the bell.
When we all pack up there's room in my wagon for anything you want to take with you.
You would always have the horse and cart to bring you to see me in.
So he left with a strange man who earns his living walking on a rope a hundred feet above the ground, and he went into town with his wagon for the fair.
